verses.verse: (Ps. 37:27; Is. 1:16, 17) Depart from evil and do good; ((Rom. 14:19; Heb. 12:14)) Seek peace and pursue it.
(Job 36:7; (Ps. 33:18)) The eyes of the LORD are on the righteous, And His ears are open to their cry.
(Lev. 17:10; Jer. 44:11; Amos 9:4) The face of the LORD is against those who do evil, (Job 18:17; Ps. 9:6; 109:15; (Prov. 10:7)) To cut off the remembrance of them from the earth.
The righteous cry out, and (Ps. 34:6; 145:19) the LORD hears, And delivers them out of all their troubles.
((Ps. 145:18)) The LORD is near (Ps. 51:17; (Is. 57:15)) to those who have a broken heart, And saves such as have a contrite spirit.
(Prov. 24:16) Many are the afflictions of the righteous, (Ps. 34:4, 6, 17) But the LORD delivers him out of them all.
He guards all his bones; (John 19:33, 36) Not one of them is broken.
(Ps. 94:23; 140:11; Prov. 24:16) Evil shall slay the wicked, And those who hate the righteous shall be condemned.
The LORD (1 Kin. 1:29) redeems the soul of His servants, And none of those who trust in Him shall be condemned.
The LORD the Avenger of His People A Psalm of David. ([1]) Plead my cause, O LORD, with those who strive with me; Fight against those who fight against me.
Take hold of shield and buckler, And stand up for my help.
Also draw out the spear, And stop those who pursue me. Say to my soul, “I am your salvation.”
(Ps. 40:14, 15; 70:2, 3) Let those be put to shame and brought to dishonor Who seek after my life; Let those be (Ps. 129:5) turned back and brought to confusion Who plot my hurt.
(Job 21:18; Ps. 83:13; Is. 29:5) Let them be like chaff before the wind, And let the angel of the LORD chase them.
Let their way be (Ps. 73:18; Jer. 23:12) dark and slippery, And let the angel of the LORD pursue them.
For without cause they have (Ps. 9:15) hidden their net for me in a pit, Which they have dug without cause for my life.
Let ((Ps. 55:23); Is. 47:11; (1 Thess. 5:3)) destruction come upon him unexpectedly, And let his net that he has hidden catch himself; Into that very destruction let him fall.
And my soul shall be joyful in the LORD; It shall rejoice in His salvation.

(Ps. 51:8) All my bones shall say, “LORD, ((Ex. 15:11); Ps. 71:19; 86:8; (Mic. 7:18)) who is like You, Delivering the poor from him who is too strong for him, Yes, the poor and the needy from him who plunders him?”
Fierce witnesses rise up; They ask me things that I do not know.
(Ps. 38:20; 109:5; Jer. 18:20; John 10:32) They reward me evil for good, To the sorrow of my soul.
But as for me, (Job 30:25) when they were sick, My clothing was sackcloth; I humbled myself with fasting; And my prayer would return to my own heart.
I paced about as though he were my friend or brother; I bowed down heavily, as one who mourns for his mother.
But in my adversity they rejoiced And gathered together; Attackers gathered against me, And I did not know it; They tore at me and did not cease;
With ungodly mockers at feasts They gnashed at me with their teeth.
Lord, how long will You (Ps. 13:1; (Hab. 1:13)) look on? Rescue me from their destructions, My precious life from the lions.
I will give You thanks in the great assembly; I will praise You among many people.
(Ps. 69:4; 109:3; Lam. 3:52; (John 15:25)) Let them not rejoice over me who are wrongfully my enemies; Nor let them wink with the eye who hate me without a cause.
